subject: Re: [junit] Re: Can i do a assertion inside the setUp() method.
msgSnippet: Hi , Instead i tried with a simple sample as below, //------------------------ package junit.samples; import junit.framework.*; import java.util.*; public
messageBody:
Hi ,
Instead i tried with a simple sample as below,

package junit.samples;

import java.util.*;

public class modelTest extends TestCase{

super(name);
}

protected void setUp() {
_collection = new ArrayList();
_collection = null;
assertNotNull("Collection null in my setupmethod
",_collection);

}

// assertTrue(_collection.isEmpty());
}

_collection.add("itemA");
// assertEquals(1, _collection.size());

Note in the above i commented the assertions inside my test methods
are commented. When i run the test , i get the below resut,

1)

ror: Collection null in my setupmethod

its not a advised practise to use assertion inside setup ?
